description: Users currently have no way to browse and select project repositories through the UI. This creates friction in the workflow when creating sessions or configuring projects, requiring users to manually type paths or work outside the application to determine the correct repository location.

stories.title: Browse File System
stories.description: As a** Ralph user I want** to browse my local file system in an intuitive interface So that** I can easily navigate to my project repository without memorizing the full path
acceptance_criteria: File picker displays current directory path
User can navigate up to parent directories
User can click into subdirectories
Directories are visually distinguished from files
File picker shows a tree or list view of directories
UI is responsive and works across desktop, web, and mobile platforms
Typecheck passes

stories.title: Select Repository Directory
stories.description: As a** Ralph user I want** to select a specific directory as my project repository So that** I can proceed with session creation or configuration
acceptance_criteria: User can click a directory to select it
Selected directory is visually highlighted
"Select" or "Choose" button confirms the selection
Selected path is returned to the parent component
User cannot select files (only directories)
Selection is validated before confirmation
Typecheck passes

stories.title: Search and Filter Directories
stories.description: As a** Ralph user I want** to search or filter directories by name So that** I can quickly find my repository in large directory structures
acceptance_criteria: Search input field is visible in file picker
Directories are filtered as user types
Search is case-insensitive
Search highlights or filters matching directories
Clear button resets search filter
Search works without delay or performance issues
Typecheck passes

stories.title: Quick Access to Common Locations
stories.description: As a** Ralph user I want** quick access to common directories (Home, Documents, Projects) So that** I can navigate to frequently used locations faster
acceptance_criteria: Sidebar or shortcut list shows common locations
Clicking a shortcut navigates to that directory
Common locations include: Home, Documents, Desktop, common project folders
Shortcuts are platform-appropriate (Linux, macOS, Windows)
Recent or favorited directories appear if applicable
Typecheck passes

stories.title: Handle Permission Errors Gracefully
stories.description: As a** Ralph user I want** clear feedback when I try to access restricted directories So that** I understand why I cannot navigate to certain paths
acceptance_criteria: Permission denied errors are caught
User sees a clear error message
File picker remains functional after error
User can navigate to alternate directories
Protected directories show a lock icon or indicator
Typecheck passes

stories.title: Remember Last Selected Path
stories.description: As a** Ralph user I want** the file picker to remember my last selected or browsed directory So that** I can quickly return to my working directories
acceptance_criteria: File picker opens to last used directory by default
Last path is persisted between sessions
User can override and start from home if needed
Path memory is specific to the user/context
Typecheck passes

stories.title: Visual Git Repository Indicator
stories.description: As a** Ralph user I want** to see visual indicators for directories that contain Git repositories So that** I can quickly identify valid project repositories
acceptance_criteria: Directories with `.git` folder show a Git icon or indicator
Indicator is visible in the directory list
Non-Git directories do not show the indicator
User can filter to show only Git repositories
Typecheck passes
